website_summaries.verdict: A high quality HyperX gaming headset with cross-platform compatibility for most gaming consoles.
pros: Large speakers offer a more distortion-free experience than many gaming headsets
Compatible with PC, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and Playstation 4 platforms
cons: Headphones lack padding around the inner side of the speaker, causing potential discomfort

website_summaries.verdict: Kingston's HyperX Cloud Alpha gaming headset couples good build quality with strong audio performance.
pros: Includes two cables and a carrying bag

customer_reviews.title: Definitely WORTH IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this headset and wore it for quite some time! I absolutely love it. I hope my video review is helpful to you!~ :) EDIT: I noticed a lot of people forget... please make sure you're PLUGGING the cable ALL THE WAY IN! ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good but...
customer_reviews.text: First off these sound fine but to get the most out of these you’ll probably want to get the amp that HyperX makes, it gives these virtual 7.1 surround sound and really improves the sound quality but it should have been included as far as I’m concerned. Secondly and more importantly to me, these were terribly uncomfortable. I have a larger than average size head but I’ve never had this sort of discomfort with any other headphones or headset I’ve ever used. I guess I’ll have to keep looking to find a good headset, it’s unfortunate I have to spend $8 to send this torture device back.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mayhem

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones Ruined By Awful Crosstalk
customer_reviews.text: The headphones are incredibly comfortable and sound excellent. Even the microphone quality is fantastic. The problem arises in the crosstalk that occurs with them. It turns out this is a pretty common problem with this headset (which can be seen pretty easily with a quick Google search). Ended up returning them and probably heading back to Logitech products, which is unfortunate since I loved everything about these besides that problem.
customer_reviews.author: Bepis

customer_reviews.title: do not buy this cheap ass headset
customer_reviews.text: the side cushion for your ear came off after use one day, there is no way in hell to get it back on without super gluing a small section at a time and working your way around it in a circular motion, this is harder than mounting a tire to a wheel.. i cannot believe this is so difficult and I am no fool by any means, please do not do this to yourself
customer_reviews.author: fortnite gamer ninja

customer_reviews.text: purchased as a gift for my partner's belated 28th bday. he says "they're comfortable, light weight, my friends say that my voice sounds very clear on their end. (in comparison to my old turtle beach) very high quality in the sound through the headphones. very sturdy design/build. the features are really nice. oh & all the mentions in the reviews to make sure they're plugged in completely. do that. make sure they're plugged in completely. these are great headphones, i'm just hoping the price reflects their capability to last." so all & all these headphones are great.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Freed

customer_reviews.title: bad echo
customer_reviews.text: head phones sound amazing. they feel amazing on the ear and they are more or less noise cancelling. sadly when you speak into the mic, it has a very bad echo. These headphones are really only good for private listening and console single player games that dont require a mic. That being said, the audio sounds AMAZING, and i love these headphones. I put in a request with support and it came back with a bunch of wasted time, a firmware update that didnt fix it, and now they want me to pay to send them back. looking at a different pair of gamer headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones
customer_reviews.text: These are great for gaming. The microphone comes across very clearly and the audio quality is great. The noise cancelling is pretty significant. It cancels ambient noise better than most other headphones I've used, but isn't on the same level as active noise cancelling. Comfort is great on these. They don't squeeze too tight and are soft on the ears and head. The cable is braided and seems very sturdy. The pivoting mechanism also seems very sturdy, which is how most of my headphones break. Overall these headphones are great and seem like they'll last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Use For PC Gaming
customer_reviews.text: Constant static pickup on headset despite having a new splitter/3.5mm jack connector sent to me by HyperX themselves. This issue is not present when using the headset on a Google Pixel 2 or consoles. Either the build quality of the splitters suck or this headset is simply intended for console gaming and not PC. It's such a shame because the actual audio quality is phenomenal. But the static bleeds into my mic and eliminates Discord use altogether as a result.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan S.

customer_reviews.title: Completely Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: I tried replacing a pair of very high quality over the ear headphones with this headset based on reviews and recommendations, and I was incredibly disappointed with the product. For anyone who cares about sound quality, neither this headset nor any headset will give you what you're looking for. I personally ordered and tried this product, and tried probably 15 other headsets at Micro Center and none of them were up to par. I ended up getting a pair of the Sennheiser HD 300 studio monitor headphones, and they are exactly what I was looking for. The sound quality is infinitely more impressive with the studio monitors, and I can simply use a webcam as a microphone.
customer_reviews.author: jacksoar

customer_reviews.title: Plug in microphone is of garbage quality
customer_reviews.text: So these headphones are comfortable but far from reliable. This is the 2nd set I've bought and having the same issue where the earphones work and I can hear incoming audio just fine. The problem is the stupid plug in microphone...it worked for a grand total of 3 hours and will not work. I've tried it using a microphone detection app on my phone, trying it in a PlayStation party to see if I can see my voice is detected, and I also tried it on my computer and absolutely nothing I am really considering using a different brand of headset after this. I know that it is my microphone and not the ear piece.
customer_reviews.author: Hayley Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Clip Came Broken
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks because I wanted to test the sound of these. I love them, great sound quality (stereo) and great comfort. The only thing that was wrong is that the clip for the audio adjuster was chipped when it came and broke off even after I tried to superglue it. The headset wasn’t damaged thankfully so really disappointed that I spent all this money and I couldn’t something as simple as an unbroken clip. I guess that’s what happens when you buy online. I would also say that 7.1 surround sound doesn’t make a difference so save some money and get a cheaper headset.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Speakers are great, maybe I got a bad mic though
customer_reviews.text: I really love this headset. it doesn't smash my head and give me headaches. It doesn't make my ears hurt and at the start I didn't have to yell at it or basically be eating the mic for people to hear me but after about a month I had problems with sensitivity and I kept being told I was too quiet or people couldn't hear me at all. Sent it back and ordered a new one. We'll see how the replacement does.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I give it 1 star because after very little use the plug that goes into the computer broke off. The plug fit too tight and broke off while being pulled straight back. To make matters worse, as far as I can tell the company foes not sell a replacement cord that doesn’t also include an inline mic. Buy something else, definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, not so great value
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for gaming at home and like them a lot. Comfortable and light. Sounds are very clear and precise. I decided to buy another pair for my desk at work, but I bought the HyperX Cloud Core, which was about half the price of this headset. I cannot tell the difference between the two besides the color. Unless you're an audiophile, I recommend the Core series. For team FPS games, the mic picks up keystrokes and annoys the teammates, so the mic is not directional. I purchased dampeners for my mechanical keyboard and that solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Garret

customer_reviews.title: Mic Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: i bought this brand new because my other headset mic broke and i need to talk during online classes and when i tested it out the mic didn't work(Brand-new and it doesn't work) i will be returning this and be getting something better that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be the quality at this price
customer_reviews.text: This headset handles any games audio that I have played very well. Chatting with the mic with random teammates is great and their voice comes through clearly without distorting game sounds. Random teammates have complimented the quality of this headsets mic. I have nothing negative to say which should not be taken lightly since I could write an essay in the cons of owning any razer or turtle beach headsets.
customer_reviews.author: Indyjh

customer_reviews.title: HyperX Cloud Alpha: Excellent choice for any gamer
customer_reviews.text: This HyperX Cloud Alpha headset is awesome. Built like a tank, great colors, and comfortable. The cable and mic are both replaceable which is nice if one breaks. I also see HyperX respond in the forums to customer concerns often which is wonderful customer service. My set has a large channel imbalance between the left and right side making it impossible to enjoy. I'm working with HyperX on getting a new set, but I would not hesitate to purchase this product again. Excellent headset and I use mine exclusively on Xbox One.
customer_reviews.author: Blur

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming and music headset!
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great - both for video games and music. The biggest thing for me is that there is enough padding on the top - other headphones started to hurt after 30 minutes. These seem to be built very well. I love having the volume control on the cord. I turned the PS4 volume all the way up and then control the volume with the dial. They are plenty loud. The dual chamber to reduce distortion really works - I can hear the difference compared to my previous pair. I feel they are worth the full retail price, but are a steal at the Black Friday price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a must for imersive gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I pretty much just got this in and have got to say that it's absolutely swicked! I mean not to give into something I just ordered and not even a week in, but after experimenting with sound controls on my pc, this headset has completely upgraded my game experience and even music listening. The 7.1 sound created an even more imersive side to gaming and the occasional movie watching. The feeling over my ears are so comfortable and satisfying. The flexibility of swapping and replacing the pads are a great bonus. The price is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Products
customer_reviews.text: An impressive product from a very well known company. Got what I expected and I anticipated from the videos I had seen online. The surround sound is great for gaming and the lightness of the headset is something unparalleled by any other headset I've experienced. I love being able to remove the microphone from the headset which will allow me to wear it in public without it looking cringey. I hope to see more quality products from HyperX in the future. I thought the price was mainly to pay for the brand, but for the most part it's not. I caught this on sale with 10% off so I am even more impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie B,

customer_reviews.title: Finally - A headset that I like
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the best wired headsets available in this price range (under $100). I like the fact that there is more metal than plastic (I love many of the competitors). The noise cancellation works well - I play with a ceiling fan above me when I game and with other headsets, it sounds like a chopper above me - I do not have this problem with this headset. The sound quality is great as well. Overall, this is a great headset that I would recommend to others.
customer_reviews.author: Luminous Matrix

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this. First of all it is as cheaply made as possible. Unacceptable considering it costs a premium. The real problem is the cord that connects this to the computer is defective. It keeps cutting out due to shoddy wiring that comes back if you twist the wire just beyond the USB connection. After hours of dealing with this, it's time for me to throw this out and find something...anything...that works. This doesn't work. And its easy to see why.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality...however
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this headset is undoubtedly great for the price you pay. The metal frame seems very durable and the padding is soft and not too stubborn. My only complaint is the fact that because I have a rather large head this headset does apply quite a bit of pressure to my jaw area in the front of the earphones. I am a rather moderate gamer so it doesn't bother me enough to request a refund but just a fair warning for those of you with a larger melon such as myself. Nevertheless, I definitely recommend this headset for anyone wanting great quality without abusing your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Austin

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seal my ears fully
customer_reviews.text: NO doubt great audio quality for gaming, however, I believe these are hit and misses not with the quality but with your head and ear size. Even when these were comfortable around my head, it didn't fully cover my ears, the bottom of the ears had a gap which allowed for the outside noise to affect the volume. I heard that Cloud 2 are better and I have tried them and I believe they are better, however for now I'll stay away from these since they're quite pricey and the HyperX Stingers are actually perfect for my head/ears.
customer_reviews.author: Jh

customer_reviews.title: Beware of laptop mics
customer_reviews.text: Rating this 3 stars because I tried to hook it up to my laptop (ASUS ROG Zephyrus M Thin and Portable Gaming Laptop, 15.6” 240Hz FHD IPS, NVIDIA GeForce RTX 2070, Intel Core i7-9750H, 16GB DDR4 RAM, 1TB PCIe SSD, Per-Key RGB, Windows 10 Home, GU502GW-AH76, purchased through amazon) but the mic in the laptop couldn’t be disabled while the headset was on. Great sound quality, noise cancellation is on point, works well with my desktop (though I had to uninstall and reinstall the Realtek drivers to get it to work). Comfort is 8/10 (a bit bulky) and it’s relatively easy to store, as the mic detaches.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for a headset and well made
customer_reviews.text: Quality of materials seems very good. I bought for use on zoom and skype and these are very good for that. I'm not a gamer but I think they would perform very well in that application also. I mean how hard can it be to reproduce gunfire and explosions? If you are looking for high quality music reproduction, well, keep looking because these will be disappointing. Compared to moderately priced Hifiman cans, these sound truly awful. On comfort, I can wear them for hours without problem.
customer_reviews.author: W McBride

customer_reviews.title: have the same headset for 7 years
customer_reviews.text: I still have my Razor black sharks but I bought in 2013, and they still work great but I was worried that with the FPS shooters that I played my Hardware was a bit old, so I picked these up and it was a totally different experience significantly lighter than I expected I do like the removable Mike but I do wish they had a plug for it kind of like the black shark with removable mic and the metal piece that went inside of it when not in use hopefully this holds up just as long
customer_reviews.author: TiedStatistic

customer_reviews.title: A whole new world
customer_reviews.text: Noise cancellation is the best. I can't hear my husband or toddler screaming or the dog barking while on my computer. Video games sound AMAZING, it's a whole new world of immersion. Previously I had been using Krakens for the last 10 or so years. HyperX is so much higher quality in every way. I am a woman with an average sized head I guess, I do not find this headset too big or small, it is perfect for me. I find it very comfortable to wear for hours of gaming after my kid goes to bed.
customer_reviews.author: Llorac

customer_reviews.title: Love this headset
customer_reviews.text: I've only begun to use this headset. I am very impressed with the sound quality, and the controls. While I have not used it for gamin, yet, the work extremely well with work applications, skype, zoom, and ms teams. I use the volume controls, as well as the controls of the chat vs system. I've gotten many compliments for the clarity of the microphone. I would buys these again without hesitation. I did quite a bit of research before landing on these, and very happy I did.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J Singler

customer_reviews.title: Headphones do not work on PS4. COMPANY LIED
customer_reviews.text: So this companies website advertises that it’s PC/PS4 friendly. Bought these for PS4 use. Straight out of the box, plug into PS4 and will NOT work. After googling I find out that only recently the company “claims” these are PS4 friendly by use of downloading a Firmware update .... HOWEVER, you need a windows based computer to download firmware update. This company is all things trash. They are Definitely all about the false advertisement; the misleading information and the misrepresentation of what they can do. Definitely AVOID this company at all costs. Plenty of other companies out there that aren’t as shady. RETURNING these immediately.
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah turner

customer_reviews.title: Solid product. Love the detention cord but considering an actually Mic still.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit and nice sound quality. People do complain about hearing my pc if my volume is close to high ad there is 4 holes on each head piece making the noise travel outside the headset. People also have a hard time hearing me if my Mic is only 2 inches away. Must be super close to my Mic. Maybe this is a sign of good noise cancellation but not a huge fan of this as I might get louder than normal making it super loud.
customer_reviews.author: Adilson Silva

customer_reviews.title: Pretty comfortable; decent sound; mic works for my calls
customer_reviews.text: This is my first "gaming" headset and I'm very happy with the purchase. The headphones are large enought to actually be "over ear" which some regular headphones sometimes have issue with my ears. I can wear these much longer than I could my old headphones. I use these mainly for listening to music and participating in conference calls with the occiational gameplay. I really like the removable mic, mute button and cord extention. I would recommend these...but have limited experience with others.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Bergin

customer_reviews.title: Good mid priced headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good value The braided cables are nice. The breakout comes with it is nice and long if you need mic/headset. the connectors are nice and solid for both the 1/8" jacks and the headset jack. The top band has some nice stitching on it and is comfortable for long gaming sessions. I use this with an external SB audio card and they will get very loud.. as with most headsets feedback becomes a problem when you start to really pump the volume (things like gun shots in tarkov can come thru and annoy your mates). All this is my best pick for sub $100 gaming headphones for 2019 so far
customer_reviews.author: supreme lord jeff

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these headphones in May of 2018.
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was that these headphones are the most comfortable pair of headphones I have ever worn. This is the only set that I've ever worn and then forgotten that I was wearing them. I have probably used them more than the average user, but the ear pads are finally, after a year and a half of near daily use at work and home, starting to give out. I highly recommend these headphones and will be picking up an extra set of the ear pads to continue using these headphones as long as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Love HyperX
customer_reviews.text: I've been using HyperX headphones for years now with the Cloud II being the set I've had the longest. I love my Cloud II's and these are just as good. They're comfortable for all-day wear and sound better than any of the other gaming brands I've tried (and I've tried quite a few). What makes them even better is the detachable audio cable. So when you try to move too far away from your desk with these still on your head, you won't yank your head, your cable, or anything else in the way. The cable will simply pull out of the headphones. :P
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Price vs sound = Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for spacial awara in games like CoD. One thing that I did dislike about it that I've had in past headphones is you can't hear yourself speak. So your not sure if you're speaking too loud or soft. Not really a fan of the sound control buttons either. They fill up surface areas so it's hard to grab it without accidentally turning volume up or down. Still, cost vs sound warrants a 4 star rating from me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D

customer_reviews.title: STOPPED WORKING AFTER 2 WEEKS
customer_reviews.text: this headset had a life of about 2 weeks. It has already stopped working. Get what you pay for. On top of the headset going out so fast, the wire is a horrible fabric and tangles its self up and you can never get it to stay completely straight. Seriously never been more disappointed with an amazon purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful... To bad they don't work
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of them, while I was able to get them to work on a cell phone, I was not able to get the mic to work on any of the 4 Windows 10 computers that I tried them on. Too bad because they look very nice and feel comfortable. The customer support guy I talked to was trying to tell me that all the computers were not up to date, but I'm always checking to make sure that Windows is up to date and when I went to check it said it was in fact up to date, also made sure the audio driver was up to date as well.
customer_reviews.author: THBrett

customer_reviews.title: Great with my PS4 Pro and Gear VR
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the HyperX Cloud Core headset. I returned them and purchased these for the unique bass setup and controls on the cable. I am glad I did. These are really great for gaming and not too bad for music. I use them on my PS4 Pro and Gear VR. These sound better in my opinion, than my over $300 Audio-Technica headphones, that I use primarily for music. The only downside is the bulk. I will not be using these while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie E. Hicks

customer_reviews.title: One of the best headset i ever had so far. I been using these for 2 years and still going...
customer_reviews.text: This headset has been with me through thick and thin. I am proud to say this thing has survived many falls off the table and many more without any problems caused afterwards. The ear pads are worn out for once before the headset has gone bad. Definetly worth the 100$ for sure. These will last you a long time. I used to have Logitech H250 till now because of the comfort and sound quality they provided but these once are Comfortable af and don't disappoint at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mohammad Hammad Raja

customer_reviews.title: It has sidetone.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty sure I got a broken set because the mic is awesome but the speakers are really bad like idk compared to my other hyper x these sound so bad. A 2$ pair of head phones sounds better. Now they won't even work any more on the PC. Going to try again in the after noon to see if I can get them working right but idk everything is good except the speakers. They just don't work right . It sounds like really bad . Like when I'm playing a game there is no bass. I've never had a gaming head set with bass on 0
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: Hyper x makes some amazing affordable gaming headsets. The alpha headset competes with others that cost 2 and 3x as much in every department. Build quality, look and feel, comfort, mic quality and sound quality. These things are awesome in every way. I have a little portable headphone amp from fiio and it really makes these things shine even more. Their dual chambered 50mm drivers can more than handle the extra power they gain from the use of an amp (you don't need it though) and really brings forth the true power of this headsets sound. Would definitely recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Devon R

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: After my headset of 5 years finally stopped working I had to decide on a new one. I think I made an excellent choice. They are the most comfortable headphones I own. They fit snugly around the ear without causing discomfort and do a great job of blocking out noise. The microphone is detachable, so when you're not gaming, it can be put away for safe keeping. Excellent headset.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, great sound, fine with glasses
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving these headphones. They're very comfortable and I'm having no problems with wearing glasses. The sound quality is truly excellent, and I have good Bose headphones so I feel confident in my opinion. The noise canceling is fine but of course better without glasses. Nobody I've spoken with online has had any trouble hearing me well on the mic. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: RetroFresh

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE LOVE LOVE THESE HEADSETS
customer_reviews.text: I really love and these headsets and I recommend anyone looking for a lightweight headset with AMAZING SOUND QUALITY to purchase these.never before have I had a headset that emerged me into the game like these do.You can hear every step,Bullet,plane ,pen with these headphones.Not only gaming but music with these headphone are incredible.overall I’d say the only downfall would be the wired from your control to headset but that’s my opinion I’m a A50 guy but the mic and sound quality is really worth the buck for these inexpensive high quality head phones...leggooooo!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wish i bought them sooner
customer_reviews.text: absolutely love these headsets for gaming on my PC, wish I had first bought them when I built my PC two years ago, but better late then never. I did find that the microphone does not work with my Xbox One, so I had to buy the Xbox specific version of this headset for the Xbox. That aside, these are comfortable and can endure long sessions with pain or discomfort, I wear glasses too it should be added. The sound is amazing, you can hear everything at every direction thanks to all of the drivers and design, best sounding gaming headsets ever.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Microphone issues break an otherwise great headset.
customer_reviews.text: Sounds leak from headset to microphone through the wires. If you plan to play with friends and use the mic that comes with the headset, I cannot recommend this. I returned it for the Cloud II and have had no issues. That being said, the build is incredible, headset is sturdy and comfortable. Sound quality is top notch, slightly better than the Cloud IIs. Just sucks that it was borderline unusable because of the mic issues.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Walker

customer_reviews.title: Withstood the test of time, still worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I've had these for 3 years now. Other than the fact that the faux leather on the earcups is peeling off, everything else about my headphone still works and looks brand new. For the price, you get a decent microphone and exceptional sound with the right adjustments. Most importantly, I can wear these for hours without feeling fatigued. I've had an amazing experience with customer service as well, so that's a big plus!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Smelly headset
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great about this headset: looks, audio quality, comfort. Except that they have a very strong garlic odor that basically makes them unusable. It is not the kind of new electronics smell that goes away after a while. This smell is on a different level. I looked online and there are plenty of people complaining about the same problem so it is not an isolated case.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: If You're a Gamer, Get This.
customer_reviews.text: I previously used the HyperX Cloud IIs for 3.5 years. I then switched to the Logitech G Pro X because I heard lots of wonderful things about it. Long story short I did not find it comfortable at all. I then decided I would buy this headset. 100x more comfortable and it is great for games and watching videos. I can wear this for hours and not get fatigue on my ears or head. Sound is very good and the bass adjustment feature is also a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Good all-purpose gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: I tried numerous wired headsets that used a 3.5 mm connection, and this was definitely the best. The cord doesn't transmit a lot of extra sounds (from rubbing on the chair/fabric), and it has an option for a combined mic/headphones single 3.5 mm plug (TRSS, I believe) or traditional separate mic and headphones 3.5 mm plugs. Good controls on the cord for mute/volume, and the build quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Chris_C

customer_reviews.title: 1 year owner
customer_reviews.text: Love them, great price for good quality. Comfortable for long use. The ear cuffs will eventually peel, but you can buy a new set for like 10 USD if it bothers you. Convenient for on the go, plug and play even for consoles if you can plug it into it. hyper X does sell adapters if you dont have a controller with an audio plug-in port.
customer_reviews.author: Ferris H.

customer_reviews.title: Echos
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully it's just a faulty set. It echos like crazyyyy.. I'll even have the mic turned off and still my friends are getting feedback from it. Did everything I could through xbox to fix it, but no dice. Otherwise, the set feels good on my head after hours of playing. I'll update it when I get a new set Update: Got the new set, the echoing is fixed. I can actually hear where players are coming from. Still keeping it at 3 stars because I had to pay return shipping. I only had these for 2 months? I can see after a year having to pay, but thats pretty lame.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin F

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality product with no durability even in great conditions.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in July 2020 and they are already breaking down. My mic echos on PC and Xbox while talking to friends. I have tried two different controllers, cords and gaming systems which no matter what this mic echos. I have the volume turned down to a fairly low volume and it still echos in voice chat. I will also mention I take GREAT care of my tech equipment since I do work in IT and I leave these headphones on my gaming desktop so they do not experience rough conditions. One star due to poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Weaver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent gaming headset
customer_reviews.text: Pros: + Sound quality is fantastic + Works well with many games that support some level of directional sound for enhanced awareness + Sounds great for other uses, like music, movies, voice chat + Comfortable for smaller heads, unlike many competitors + Great cords + Ear cushions and headbands holding up well so far Cons: - (Minor) Volume control in cord somewhat easy to bump and no extra components to swap out like first one - (Minor) Ear cushions are better than first HyperX Cloud, but there are no replacements like first one
customer_reviews.author: Timber

customer_reviews.title: Dont trust what PC Magazine tells you
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones because I searched for found that according to PC Magazine they were the top of the line headphones for gaming. What I found was they are not at all. The sound quality is very poor. It would seem that somebody paid PC Magazine to promote the headphones without providing a proper review compared to others. My 35 dollar headphones are 10 times better sound quality. They are not worth the 100 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones yet
customer_reviews.text: These are the best headphones I have ever used for the PC. I have had corsiars, turtle beach, logitech and several other brands over the years. These beat all in form and function. In the past a lot of my headsets would break at the cord or the mic. The fact that both are removable and replaceable on this set is a huge bonus. Pros: comfortable, replaceable mic and cord Con: Can hear ringing noise when quite-no worse than other headsets I've had. Planing on hooking it up through a DAC to mitigate this as it is likely just feedback from the port on the PC
customer_reviews.author: shane

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Cords!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a few weeks ago to replace my HyperX Cloud 2s because of THE SAME ISSUE. The cord gets automatically tangled up! I thought my other headset was just defective but after buying this one and the same thing happening so fast I will NEVER buy HyperX again. The cord has to be stretched out every single time I use it. So annoying, especially because how new this headset was. I contacted HyperX to see what I could do and they sent me an automated BS response back. That triggered me so bad I'm just returning this and never ever buying a HyperX headset.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these, but I've had them for 11 days and they already broke!
customer_reviews.text: The inline adapter is no longer recognized by Windows. I read about it and apparently, this means this POS in the middle that connects to give me the 7.1 sound and mute, etc is trash. I'm gonna see if I can get an RMA and if not, these are going back and I'm not replacing them. Going to get something else that's not Kingston trash.
customer_reviews.author: yuckypants

customer_reviews.title: Random static, wire short?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what it is but every once in awhile when I have sound playing, it'll start making this static noise. I begin messing with the wire shaking it and such, and it begins getting louder. Eventually after continuing to mess with the wiring it'll stop and go back to normal for awhile until it happens again. Very annoying especially when gaming. Highly recommend against it.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Leisy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gaming practically indestructible
customer_reviews.text: By far the best gaming headset I’ve ever owned and I’ve had dozens of headsets and these by far blow all them out of the water... the sound it beautiful and these headset are practically indestructible!!! I have two daughters that always play with them and throw them all over the place, everyday I come home and they are on the floor hahah and still have not had a problem with them!!! Well worth the 99$ asking price
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: 7.1 Surround Audio is Trash
customer_reviews.text: These HyperX Cloud Alpha S headphones have been great quality so far. Not uncomfortable at all. Initially, I bought these to have a USB headset, but I have a problem with the 7.1 Surround Sound adapter. When plugged in, all audio sounds muffled, and there's no driver or program from HyperX that I could find to change how muffled it all sounds. Kind of disappointed, because that adapter has a mic monitor, volume, mute, and a chat balancing feature that I would like to utilize. It has a 3.5mm plug in that can be inserted into a splitter, which is fine, and that fixes the audio issue. Still kind of disappointing as far as the adapter goes, but whatever.
customer_reviews.author: Ifah Kyormom

customer_reviews.title: Amazing FPS (CSGO) Headset! Great overall for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great! Not the best for music, however I have headphones for that, and have these for gaming. I hear footsteps more clearly, and from farther away than I ever did with the Razer Kraken Pro headset. (I bought 2 sets of those and had used them for many years, and I am glad I made the switch. Kraken were great all around, but these are overall better for gaming). Gunshots are more clear, and I feel these were made for first person shooters.. And are PERFECT for CS:GO.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Laisney

customer_reviews.title: One of the sturdiest headsets I've owned, and still sounds amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this headset about 2 years ago and don't regret my purchase. I was in the market for a cool looking gaming headset with good sound and build quality and came across this. Once I received it, I was surprised by everything because I've never owned a high-quality headset. I've dropped this headset countless times (like... a lot) and it's still in great shape. The metal and plastic construction have held up well and it's very comfortable as well. The microphone it came with also worked well. I would definitely recommend this as a great purchase and investment for a gaming headphone, especially at the price I purchased it ($100).
customer_reviews.author: Mommy on Strike

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, yet I have issues.
customer_reviews.text: I've done everything I can find online to fix an echo I have with these headphones. No matter what I do, people can hear twitch streams when I listen to them and I dont have the volume up that loud at all. Sometimes my mic has an echo(I've tweaked the settings in the properties and in discord itself, nothing). I didn't have this issue at all with my last pair of headphones. Feelsbadman
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Not much bass.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is wonderful with the exception of bass. There is decent bass, but not enough in my opinion. Also, on the PS4 playing COD even with the USB dongle updated and in use with 7.1, the difference between friendly and enemy footsteps is almost indistinguishable. If I had it to do over, I would have bought a different headset.
customer_reviews.author: Grumbly

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, good build, but not perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Good mic quality (for comms, not bass heavy) Structurally sound Comfortable on a large head 7.1 digital sound is decent Inline sidetone Good volume mixer Cons: Occasional static Mic could be better for this price point. Audio mix can be troublesome Soundcard on cable too far down to clip
customer_reviews.author: Kevork M.

customer_reviews.title: Left Speaker Diminished After 8 Months
customer_reviews.text: The headset performed perfectly until today (11NOV18) when I put the headset on and noticed that the left speaker was suddenly working at half volume. This was after having used the headset the night prior without issue. I tested all cable connections and sound settings, then tested 2 other sources. Then to make sure it wasn't the sources I tried my backup headset. This confirmed that it was the Cloud Alpha that was not functioning correctly. Attempted to submit a warranty return on the hyperxgaming RMA website, however the form refuses to submit.
customer_reviews.author: Trihalo

customer_reviews.title: Mic Echo is annoying!
customer_reviews.text: My hyper x alpha’s echoed uncontrollably! I bought these for my Xbox one and I’m disappointed. When trying to communicate my friends would constantly hear an echo. I tried adjusting the game mix and mic volume but at best I just made the echo sound smaller. I looked online and found similar problems with this headset. I love the design and comfort of the alphas. I just wish they wouldn’t mic echo. I made sure my cords were plugged in directly from my headset to my brand new Xbox one controller. Be weary. It’s more of a hit or miss. I will be returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Espinoza

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I was super skeptical about these, even though I read in a gaming mag that they were rated top for comfort. I needed something I could wear for 12 hours a day and I worried that choosing comfort would sacrifice quality. I have not been let down. Best headset I ever owned. Was hard for me to spend the money, being on a fixed income, but it was extremely worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Silas

customer_reviews.title: the best gaming headset I've owned
customer_reviews.text: So far, the best gaming headset I've owned. I had Turtle Beach head sets before and the plastic all crumbled on their own. This one has an amazing build, and a quality feel to the materials used. Sits comfortably on the head, without gaining stress/discomfort with long periods of use. The removable wire and mic is great which means replaceable if accidentally broken. The wire itself is sturdy wrapped in black nylon. The removable mic means you can use it as headphones outside of gaming. The sounds are amazing, and noise cancelling is scary good as I couldn't hear anything outside of the game/movie (get ready to be screamed at by your loved ones for not hearing them). Love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Vic D.

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
customer_reviews.text: Wow, where to start. The headset is super comfortable. No issues wearing for hours on end. Its built solid and feels like it will give me years of use. The headset has no surround sound but it still carries great audio. I'm able to hear and pinpoint footsteps and movement. Voice audio sounds great. Mic is clear with no distortion. Detachable mic and cord, nice little carry case. All in all I'm happy with my purchase and would highly recommend for anyone looking for a headset under $100 that has great audio/mic, is comfortable as hell, and is of great build quality.
customer_reviews.author: Zygz

customer_reviews.title: Good sound quality, but not free of problems.
customer_reviews.text: This headset makes games and music sound wonderful. However, it is not without drawbacks. First, the microphone is not great. I had to turn on push to talk because my friends could hear my youtube videos in the background. This was annoying because you practically have to eat the attached microphone for anyone to be able to hear you. Second, I switched from turtle beach, which allows you to hear yourself through your headset, the HyperX Cloud Alpha does not have this feature, however, if you keep your old turtle beach amp, you can maintain this feature by running the headset through the amp. The build quality overall is great with the aluminum frame.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Horwitz

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the best headphones I have ever owned in my 61 years. I've owned 5 headphones in the past six years and was unsatisfied with each one. They either broke or the sound was cracky and intermittent. The Hyper Cloud Alpha is spot on target! It's the most comfortable pair of headphones I have ever worn, no cracks in the sounds and I can hear the footsteps in my gaming crystal clear. I stream video games on Twitch and my audience can hear me loud and clear with no interference. I'm hooked.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Quality, Good Comms
customer_reviews.text: Seems ruggedly built. Doesn’t have any RGB but I’ve had cups that were but seemingly skimped on sound quality. Good functionality of the balance. A rotating dial is more preferred coming from other industry leaders but this works as well. Difference in sound regarding virtual 7.1 is noticeably better.
customer_reviews.author: J Fogez

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable for Extended Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought these not only because I wanted good gaming headphones, but because they could serve a dual purpose as a headset for making work calls through the softphone application on my computer. The sound quality is great, the microphone picks up well, and they're just wonderfully comfortable. I have no problem wearing them for 8 hours straight for work and then through the rest of the evening for gaming. 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Delia

customer_reviews.title: Microphone is so quiet it might as well not be there
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning this product in the morning. It sounds great but the microphone doesn't work at all. I have spent all evening troubleshooting from every conceivable software solution (max volume, reinstalling drivers, restarting, changing Realtek Audio settings, etc.) to trying to force the plug in more even though it is clearly all the way in. The microphone IS working, but it is so quiet that even when I yell I can barely be heard. This was supposed to be a big upgrade from my fraying Turtle Beach PX22 but it is completely worthless to me without a working microphone.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Gerard

customer_reviews.title: mic does not pick up your voice unless everything is set to the max
customer_reviews.text: Quality build, sound was good. however it was too tight on my head. The detachable mic makes it feel much more cheap over having a retractable one or one that folds up (I imagine it will break over time taking in off and on). My headset came with an odd latexy rubbery smell that i found unpleasant. The worst thing was you have to be at full blast mic settings in discord and friends have to turn me up on their end just to get to a somewhat acceptable level of sounds so they can hear me. This is terrible. I don't care if the mic blocks out other noise if this is such an issue.
customer_reviews.author: MAC

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones, mic is alright
customer_reviews.text: Good headphones, mic is alright. Personally can't use 'em because leather earcups are very uncomfortable for me, so I'm switching back to my Beyerdynamic DT770s. Velour is the way to go. Also a combined cable (weird design of the microphone being plugged into the headphones) is nicer for cable management, but running the mic into a mixer didn't work for me so that was another reason I didn't keep it. No actual significant design flaws though, and I did enjoy them. +1
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Mic is a dealbraker
customer_reviews.text: I was a little uncertain about buying a detachable mic for the exact I've run into. Great sound on the headset, but the mic is non-functioning out of the box. Just disappointing and bad quality. Edit: Company makes you pay to send back their broken product. Beyond trash. Never buying anything from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: Vesmic

customer_reviews.title: An alright headset for PS4 sounds better on my PC
customer_reviews.text: This is a good headset but coming from turtle beach stealth 600s superhuman it's lacking bass and sound.BUT I hooked these up to my mixamp pro tr and these babies are EVERYTHING... So it's probably just the sound card that is lacking.. The game/audio mixer doesn't work on PS4...that was one of the main reasons I bought these...I was so sad
customer_reviews.author: Syleta

customer_reviews.title: So far so good but didn't last 6 months
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad but not steller either. You can buy a better audio quality headphone but have to look a lot more. I had to replace the original unit I bought because one of the ear phone cups didn't work right out of the box. This replacement is doing good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Splurge Worth the Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I can't hear people knocking on my door. It's really punchy and clear, I feel like i'm in the room on the podcasts I like. with music less so but still amazing compared to my Monoprice 10 dollar pair. I really feel like people can hear me fine on the mic too. The main reason to get these is the build quality is amazing, they are made of aluminum. They are also very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hegarty

customer_reviews.title: Great headset
customer_reviews.text: As you can see my husband loves it. Got it for him as a gift (just a random gift no special occasion), he as iffy at first because it’s on the pricey side of things but when he tried them out he really loved them. This is a perfect thank you gift from me to him and I’m getting myself one soon as well 😂
customer_reviews.author: Mikhaela

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfortable for hours
customer_reviews.text: I’m so happy with this headset! The microphone is crisp and clear and the sound quality in 7.1 is amazing. I like that I can control the voices vs music/background in the cable remote. Sometimes when I’m playing I want to hear the other people but I can put it to the background so the chatter doesn’t overwhelm the game.
customer_reviews.author: kcr

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't have USB and sounds cheap.
customer_reviews.text: My mistake overlooked the fact that this version doesn't have USB because it doesn't even say it in the item description. I just assumed in the year 2020 that would be a default feature. The sound quality isn't as good, as if it has zero bass to it. Can you find programs to work around this? Sure! Should you have to for 100.00 headset? NO! Go get the HyperX Cloud II Gaming Headset if you want a HyperX Cloud headset instead. It's cheaper, has more features and you KNOW it will work. It is comfortable to wear but I wouldn't give it any award. As far as HyperX headset's go, I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Raymond

customer_reviews.title: CROSSTALK!!!! My friends can hear my PC audio.
customer_reviews.text: Computer audio picked up by the mic. Friends in Discord roast me. Can't use it for phone calls or gaming. Can't believe this is such a highly rated headset. Disappointed. Spent the extra money on what I thought was a good headset only to get stabbed in the back. Upset I can't return because my window closed so now I have to buy a new headset to talk with my friends and this has become a paperweight. EDIT: Kingston let me warranty this item and sent me a new one after I sent them mine. The second headset did the exact same thing. Looks like a design issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Use these for gaming, chatting, and listening to music. They're uncomfortable, quiet, and disappointing at best for the price. They also aren't compatible with consoles unless you have a computer and go hunting for a software update that allows them to be used on console. It's not easy to find. The headset is complicated to use, and the only function on the mixer that actually works is the function for game audio / chat audio mixing. I should've just gotten the skullcandies I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: The headset did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: I attempted to configure the headset for use on my windows PC. While the connections worked from a software perspective, whenever I launched an application that attempted to use the microphone on the headphone, I received no sound although the sound can be seen going through the headset through UI. The sound seemed to work when using the (chat) speaker option but the audio quality is significantly lower in quality than the (game) speaker option. I will be returning them after one day.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice

customer_reviews.title: Surround Sound 7.1 is Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The package came quickly and in mint condition. The headset comes with a connector that allows you to mute, unmute, and turn on surround sound, which is an awesome feature. the headset itself is very comfortable and the noise cancelation is very nice. Also, you can adjust the bass and the earmuffs are soothing. Finally, the package comes with extra earmuffs and the manual is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: eli

customer_reviews.title: Works great but have some issues....
customer_reviews.text: I got those to replace my broken gaming headset they work great and to me the still good! But awhile chatting with my friends on ps4 where the problem come in to play! They tell me it sounds like it in a shower. So I have unplug the cord from the headset. I even try to replace the cord and still happens. I don't know why it happens my friend have the same ones and they works for him. I just think it my bad luck with wired headsets!
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: Needs a firmware update to work with PS4. Was simple to do
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I did a firmware update so that it works with PS4. Just plug into windows PC, upgrade, and boom, works. All features are as described with great sound quality and chat quality.
customer_reviews.author: Silent Mike

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return these
customer_reviews.text: I had just purchased these, and wish I had saved the box so I could send them back. The sound and performance qualities are absolutely awful! The built-in sound card is finicky, and failed completely when playing something as simple as Deep Rock Galactic. This is absolute garbage for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lorus

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, somewhat echo-y, great connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The headset is somewhat echo-y to me. It sounds good but strange. Perhaps I will get used to it in the future. Also, this headset connects with the basic 3.5mm jack - which is great since it works out-of-the-box everywhere with no drivers. I can use it with my Linux PC and my phone without a problem. This plug is only a problem for Apple users :P
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Franke

customer_reviews.title: The best headphones for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Hello gamers, I want all the gamers out there looking for a upgrade..these are definitely it. I have a mix amp that I bought separately but let me tell you what.. these bad boys are loud, crisp, and effective when it comes to fps. I play pubg all day long and these are extremely good. They're very comfortable the sound sounds amazing. You will not be disappointed if you purchase these. Oh and by the way, I got mine with in 30 hours of purchasing.. so I'm very very very pleased on the fast shipping! Good luck gamers and enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Jose ruiz

customer_reviews.title: No Good for Music
customer_reviews.text: I bought these headphones to use on my new gaming PC for game audio and occasionally listening to music. These things are terrible. The sound coming through the speakers sounds like it's blasting through a mud puddle. I have 25 dollar headphones that sound nicer than these do. I'm returning them.
customer_reviews.author: TheMagnificentR

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I had the pretty RGB Logitec headset before this. My husband and I are extreme gamers and talk in discord all the time to friends. We shared the room and you could always hear him through my headset and vice versa. I was suggested this headset from a friend and was very impressed. Worked great and I love the audio control on the wire. Husband bought the other headset from hyper x shortly after.
customer_reviews.author: Tomorrow

customer_reviews.title: Uncomfortable and Underpowered for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I found these really uncomfortable and the sound quality poor for the money. Also for as big and hulking as the ear cups are, they do a really poor job of shutting out noise from outside. The large size of the ear cups also makes them especially bad to wear over glasses, because there's no way to wear your glasses so the ear cups aren't resting on the bows and pressing them into your skull, which gets painful very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: A. Mae Stark

customer_reviews.title: These DO NOT last
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I really enjoyed these while they lasted. I purchased these on May 17, 2018. Two days ago, the mic decided to just stop picking up any noise. The warranty only lasted 6 months, so I'm SOL. I'd recommend not buying these if you want something that is going to last at least a year. I'm giving such a low rating purely because of the durability. As an environmentalist, I really don't want products to shit the bed before even a year has passed. Especially not when I was in the middle of a game of Ring of Elysium.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Askey

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh
customer_reviews.text: Very mixed review. Sound? Very good. Worth $100? Probably not but definitely on the top end. Build quality? Excellent. It feels like a $100 pair of headphones. Comfort? Excellent. Not much else to say For gaming? This is ironically where it loses value. It consistently offers echo when other people speak in a party. Never had an issue with this when I was using a cheaply made $20 headset off amazon. The quality of voice chat is also not nearly as good as expected and again outshined by the $20 headset. Put it this way... My friends thank me when I switch headsets back to the cheap one.
customer_reviews.author: William Wornom

product_meta.title: HyperX Cloud Alpha - Gaming Headset, Dual Chamber Drivers, Award Winning Comfort, Durable Aluminum Frame, Detachable Microphone, Works on PC, PS4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, and Mobile Devices – Red
product_meta.description: Color:Red| Style:Stereo| Pattern Name:HeadsetHyperXTM Cloud Alpha's groundbreaking Dual Chamber Drivers design gives audio more distinction and clarity by reducing distortion. The dual chambers separate the bass for cleaner, smoother sound. Cloud Alpha has premium red memory foam, an expanded headband and softer, more pliable leatherette, an aluminum frame, detachable braided cable and noise-cancellation microphone. Multi-platform compatible with in-line audio controls on PC, PS4, Xbox One and other platforms with 3.5mm ports. Frequency response of Microphone is 50Hz-18,000Hz. Issues due to headset detachable main cord partially inserted in the ear cup jack resulting in no microphone audio or quiet/static sounds. Customer should follow Cloud Alpha User Manual or HyperX Gaming support website headset cable attachment guidelines to properly connect the cord, activate microphone audio on the Alpha inline volume control box, and ensure Cloud Alpha configured as primary audio playback and recording device on the host system.
feature_bullets: HyperX Dual Chamber Drivers for more distinction and less distortion
Durable aluminum frame with expanded headband
Detachable braided cable with convenient in line audio control
Compatible with PC, PS4, PS4 Pro, Xbox One, Xbox One S, Mac, Mobile, Nintendo Switch, VR

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,846 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
